sentences: William Gazelle Fields Jr. (born September 25, 1993), professionally known as Aha Gazelle, is an American rapper from New Orleans, Louisiana.
In 2012, he had a project released called #TeamGMG.
In 2014, Aha released his first official mixtape, Greenbeans & Tuna, which was received well locally and online via popular mediums such as Spinrilla and Mymixtapez.
He received further recognition for "Vegeta", his most successful record to date.
Trilliam 2 was released June 9, 2017 as his debut for Reach Records.

== Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: At an early age, Aha showed an interest in music, playing trombone in middle school, and playing the drums by the age of 13 at his fatherâ€™s church.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Aha began experimenting with music production at 14 years old.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: By 15, he released his first self-produced mixtape under the name Trill Will.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: At 18, Aha became fascinated with the piano and taught himself how to play by ear, releasing #TeamGMG the following year.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He transitioned from the drums to keyboards and began playing at other churches in his native New Orleans.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He attended Grambling State University where he graduated with a bachelor's degree in business management in 2014.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He gained further recognition upon releasing Free Barabbas in 2015, which featured the singles "Gettin' Money" and "Vegeta", the latter of which proved to be his most successful single.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Aha was signed to Reach Records in 2017 by Lecrae, who had been closely watching the young artist.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: In 2018, Aha announced that he was leaving Reach Records to pursue other ventures.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Since leaving Reach Records, Aha has released several singles and, in 2020, released a new album, 180.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Most of Aha's projects are self-produced.
Aha plays piano and drums, and is also a vocalist (although he has admitted that he uses Auto-Tune).
In an interview with HipHopDX, Aha revealed that his musical influences include Master P, Lil Wayne, Kevin Gates, Boosie Badazz, Frank Ocean and PJ Morton.
